TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit HeaderElement extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a single HTTP header that is included in a response from the output cache.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Caching.HeaderElement> class represents the content of an HTTP header in the output cache as a name/value pair. Both the name and the value must be non-null. The collection of all <xref:System.Web.Caching.HeaderElement> instances for an entry in the output cache is contained in the <xref:System.Web.Caching.IOutputCacheEntry.HeaderElements%2A> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the HTTP header.
The value of the HTTP header.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.HeaderElement> class, the value of `name` must always be a non-null, non-empty string. The `value` parameter can be an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of an HTTP header that is in the output cache.
Docs.value: The name of the HTTP header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.HeaderElement> class, the value of `name` must always be a non-null, non-empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets the value of an HTTP header that is in the output cache.
Docs.value: The value of the HTTP header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Caching.HeaderElement> class, the `value` parameter can be an empty string.
